items.name: Sheikh Sharif Al-Hussein's Zawiya
items.short_description: This venerated zawiya houses the tomb of Sheikh Sharif Al-Hussein, a revered Islamic scholar and Sufi mystic, whose teachings greatly influenced Lamu's spiritual life. Pilgrims visit seeking blessings and spiritual guidance.

items.name: Utamaduni Grove
items.short_description: Tucked away behind Shela Village, Utamaduni Grove is a small, protected forest patch revered by local elders for its ancient trees and spiritual tranquility. It is believed to be a dwelling place for ancestral spirits and is used for quiet contemplation and traditional ceremonies.

items.name: Birika Baraka (Well of Blessings)
items.short_description: This ancient well, fed by an underground spring, is believed to possess healing properties and is a source of spiritual cleansing. Locals and visitors alike come to draw water, offer prayers, and seek blessings for health and prosperity.
items.address: Central Lamu Old Town, near Friday Mosque

items.name: Pango La Roho (Cave of Spirits)
items.short_description: Located along the secluded coastline, Pango La Roho is a natural rock formation used since ancient times as a sanctuary for quiet contemplation and ritual practices. Its tranquil ambiance provides a powerful space for introspection and connection with the natural world.
items.address: Manda Island (accessible by dhow from Lamu), off Shela coast
